intro: Erythroxylum lucidum, commonly known as the glossy erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, round berries that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
